events.name: Google Cloud Next Event 2017
events.description:
Google just organized the largest cloud event ever with around 100 announcements in a single evening.  Because of this, we would like to bring forth the excitement of Next ’17 to our community through the event being held on the 26th April at Faculty of ICT, University of Malta. This event is being organized by the Department of Artificial Intelligence together with the GoogleDevelopers Group in Malta and supported by Saint Martin’s Institute of Higher Education, the Malta Information Technology Agency and IXARIS.

Next’17 Extended will start around 17:30 and it will feature two talks by industry experts. The first one will be based on the future of the cloud; in particular, it will look at various emerging technologies such as blockchain and cryptocurrencies amongst others. This is extremely important in view of the country’s drive to become a FinTech hub in the coming decade. The second talk will focus on open payments over the cloud. Both talks are extremely relevant in today’s world and participants will have the opportunity to ask questions to our experts. A networking event will follow after where participants can get to socialize and get to know our speakers personally.

Through this event, we hope to help accelerate innovation through the capabilities of the cloud. We want to engage the foremost minds leading the cloud revolution and help modern enterprises benefit from the latest in cloud technology in unprecedented ways.

Since places are very limited, anyone interested must register by going to the following link 

http://tinyurl.com/CloudNextMalta2017

For further information about this and future events, please join our Facebook group 

https://www.facebook.com/gdgmalta/
events.how_to_find_us: Faculty of ICT, University of Malta

events.name: Google IO Extended Malta - 2017

venue.name: St Martin's Institute of Higher Education

events.description:
Google I/O is for developers—the creative coders who are building what's next. Together we'll explore the latest in tech, mobile & beyond.  This event will be organised in parallel of the main IO event taking place at the Google Campus at Mountain View, USA.  We will have a live stream of the event and a variety of parallel sessions delivered by local developers about best practices and novel technology.

Talks:

• Containers and their use cases with Docker (Stanislavs Obolevics) - Register here https://doodle.com/poll/nfnat24scgq78ip6

• Caching Entities using Actors in a Distributed System (Aldrin Seychell) - Register here <a>https://doodle.com/poll/pmhkta2gnsy4gmzt</a>;

• When Virtual Reality becomes better than Reality (Mark Bugeja) - Register here https://doodle.com/poll/fqgr2ywsrbe84spt

• Translating Empathy: From Film to Virtual Reality (Joe Camilleri) - Register here https://doodle.com/poll/arfxeis4mee8d3x2

events.name: Virtual Reality Evening

venue.name: St Martin's Institute of Higher Education

events.description:
Join us for an evening full of events related to the latest trends in Virtual Reality. The evening will kick off with a brief talk about the Transfer of Traditional User Exeperience to VR. This will then be followed with a selection of demos and experiments related to VR in a networking environment.

Transferring Traditional UX to VR:

Have you ever thought what it really means to design for a 3D world? While we do it all the time in our physical world by designing posters, billboards, TV adverts and even websites or mobile apps, we still have a lot to learn in order to transfer our skills to the virtual 3D world. This talk will explore Google’s latest methodologies for designing for Virtual Reality and how we can translate traditional UI design to the virtual 3D world. Following the talk, there will be a networking session and demos of a variety of Virtual Reality applications. These demos include VR applications in Heritage, behind the scenes of 360-video filming and a VR-based user research experiment.

The talk will be delivered by Dylan Seychell, a resident academic at St Martin’s Institute of Higher Education and the Lead of Malta’s Google Developers Group. Mr Seychell is a researcher and software engineer specialising in Computer Vision and UX Design.

https://www.facebook.com/events/304145856701832/

events.name: Virtual Reality in Heritage

venue.name: St Martin's Institute of Higher Education

events.description:
Technology is changing the way we explore and experience our cultural heritage. Virtual Reality allows us to venture in places that might not be accessible and lets us explore sites like never before.

This evening will kick off with a short talk about how to create meaningful experiences in our museums through Virtual Reality. A case study of St Paul's Catacombs will be presented. This talk will be delivered by SMI's UX researcher and academic, Dylan Seychell.

After the talk, SMI's labs will be open for public and you will have the opportunity to try Virtual Reality on different technology while also participating in some research.

events.name: Google Developer Days Extended - Intro to Computer Vision with Python

venue.name: St Martin's Institute of Higher Education

events.description:
This workshop will introduce the basics of Computer Vision through a hands-on approach. The participants will be building simple applications using Python and the OpenCV framework that allow us to capture and process what the machine sees. This workshop is ideal for anyone who is curious about computer vision and is willing to try out introductory examples. Elementary knowledge of programming is advised.

Please bring your laptop with you on the day. Further instructions of any configuration required will be provided prior to the event, upon registration on 

http://crm.stmartins.edu/forms/computervision

This is a basic and introductory code lab.

events.name: Explore Android's Latest with Google Dev Expert Danny Preussler
events.description:
Android is having it's 10th anniversary soon. Besides becaming the world’s largest mobile operating system, it even changed things for developers since its launch.

We'll have Google Developers Expert, Danny Preussler from Germany, with us to update us about this.

Nowadays we have great UIs and strict design guidelines, we have official tips how to architecture an android app and modern components to do so.

The way we program Android changed a lot: from functional aspects up to how we use databases. With Kotlin we even have new language that is modern and offers many new possibilities.

Let's start an app from scratch in 2018!

events.name: Google #HashCode 18 Competition Hub

venue.name: St Martin's Institute of Higher Education

events.description:
• What we'll do
Hash Code is a team programming competition organized by Google for students and industry professionals across Europe, the Middle East and Africa. You pick your team and programming language, engineers at Google pick an engineering problem for you to solve.

• What to bring
Laptop and ideally, an extension

• Important to know
It is *very important* that you register and set up the team by the 30th January if you would like to get some complementary Google branded gifts on the day! Register on https://hashcode.withgoogle.com/signup.html and then once you set up your team, choose the Malta Google Developers Group hub in Hamrun.
events.how_to_find_us: This event will be held in the New Building, entrance near the Doneo roundabout...'border' between Pieta and Hamrun :)

There will be a short demo of a face-recognition application that uses TensorFlow. venue.name: St Martin's Institute of Higher Education

events.description: We'll be hosting a public live viewing of the official keynote followed by a social event.

events.name: Google Cloud Day - Malta

venue.name: University of Malta, Lecture Centre LT1

events.description:
We are pleased to present the first Google Cloud event in Malta: "Cloud Day Malta". Please register on https://goo.gl/forms/ikXuN7ZNMrgKIXmu1

The event will take place on July 26th organized in collaboration with Malta's Google Cloud Developer Community. The event will go through a structured presentation of Google Cloud and will follow a Networking event.The event will start at 6:00 pm at the University of Malta, Lecture Theatre 1, Lecture Centre.

What is the Google Cloud Platform?

Google Cloud Platform is the cloud platform of Google that hosts modular cloud-based services, which allow you to quickly develop Business Intelligence, Data Discovery and Big Data projects. The infrastructure uses state-of-the-art hardware and software such as MapReduce, Bigtable, Dremel, Spanner and Flume. The platform made available to users is the same one that uses Google to offer its services (Youtube, Gmail and search network).

The event aims to show the vision of Cloud according to Google and potential of the Google Cloud Platform. The agenda consists of talks from Google and the local community followed by a networking event.

During the event will be our guests Matteo Andrini, Senior Account Manager in Google Cloud Italy and Malta, Davide Tamagno, Head of Startup in Google Cloud Italy and Malta, Andrea Martelli, Google Cloud Engineer, which will give you the opportunity to participants to interact directly with Google Cloud.

events.name: Women TechMakers Launch
events.description:
The launch of the WomenTechMakers Malta will be held on Tuesday 13th November from 6pm to 9pm at The State Hall, The Palace Hotel, Sliema.

Food and drinks will be served between 6pm and 7pm, during which time we can network informally. At 7pm we will be having a number of short presentations that will introduce Women TechMakers and set the tone. This will be followed by a number of parallel sessions and a final discussion bringing together all the points raised.

Complimentary parking spaces at their car park are available on a first come first serve basis.

Register for the event here https://goo.gl/forms/A8PQZucSEZvVrDQA2

events.name: Explainable AI (XAI) - Google DevFest 2018

venue.name: MP 401
venue.address_1: Maths and Physics Building, Faculty of Science

events.description:
XAI is the idea of creating Artificial Intelligence algorithms capable of explaining their purpose, rationale and decision-making process in a human understandable way. In this talk, Prof Alexiei Dingli, from the Department of Artificial Intelligence and Ms Azzurra Ragone, a Developer Relations Program Manager with Google will delve further into the topic, give an overview of the challenges and the solutions which currently exist in the field. Tickets from here: https://tinyurl.com/XAI-2018?fbclid=IwAR24jVCCJvijD3n612nukpVSSXCXmmz8Hu4atrHyzKk5BX9OgPOhnKnVMio

Bio - Ms Azzurra Ragone

As Developer Relations Program Manager, her aim is to nurture influencers and their communities in Europe to make developers successful. Diversity Advocate, she likes to promote awareness of diversity-related issues and inclusion best practices. Former research fellow in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning for several years, she started investigating these topics in 2004, when they were not yet buzz words. She worked as Business Intelligence consultant for several big companies in Europe. Passionate about Human-centered design she likes to define herself as a Service Design thinker, or better, a Service Design do-er.

Bio - Prof Alexiei Dingli

Prof Alexiei Dingli is a Professor of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Head of the Department of AI at the University of Malta. He has been conducting research and working in the field of AI for the past two decades. His work was rated World Class by international experts and won various prizes including the Semantic Web Challenge, the first prize by the European Space Agency, the e-Excellence Gold Seal, the first Prize in the Malta Innovation Awards and the World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO) award for Creativity. He has published several peer reviewed posters, papers and books in the field. He is also involved in various AI projects with private organisations and through international EU funded projects.

Malta IT Agency, Emerging Technologies Lab, Gattard House, National Road, Blata l-Bajda, Malta

Speakers

Dr Vanessa Camilleri is an academic at the Department of Artificial Intelligence, Faculty of ICT, University of Malta. Her areas of interest include Human-Computer Interactions, with a specialisation in Virtual Worlds and Serious Games as well as in the design of Virtual and Augmented Reality applications related to socio-cultural experiences.

Dylan Seychell is a resident academic in the Department of Artificial Intelligence at the University of Malta and is specialized in Computer Vision. Dylan is also the founder of Malta's Google Developers Group.

events.name: When Artificial Intelligence meets Gamification
events.description:
We are very excited to announce that the event will be split into three separate talks by professionals and academics who have worked in the area of gamification. Our first speaker is Professor Alexiei Dingli, Prof. Dingli will start the event with an introductory talk on Gamification. The second talk will be presented by Elaine Grech and Mark Bugeja, the talk will focus on combining technology with gamification with insights on tools that can be used to facilitate this process. Dr Vanessa Camilleri is our final speaker for the event tomorrow, Vanessa Camilleri will present a talk on using Gamification to address social issues and how it can be used for the common good.

The talks will be held at Lecture Hall GWHC Gateway Building, University of Malta, Msida.

You can register for the event using the form below. We suggest you register as early as possible as places are limited.

https://goo.gl/forms/A6x0NqVcyw6KJu2q2

events.name: RaspberryPI Jam 2019
events.description:
The 3rd Edition of Raspberry PI Jam on Robotics and AI organised by MaltaPI and this year supported by GDGMalta. The event is free and open for children and adults.

The event is also open to anyone who wants to exhibit and bring along their own creations - we welcome all makers (it doesn't have to use a RasPi to be eligible - Arduinos, Microbit, PIX and other controllers welcome!). If you are interested in exhibiting a project, please contact us through Facebook or the contact link below.

Saturday 9th March from 15:00 - 20:00

Talks held on Sunday

15:00 Introduction to Raspberry Pi - Speaker: Klaus Conrad
15:30 Virtual Reality and AI - Speaker: Luca Bondin
16:00 Vision and Artificial Intelligence - Speaker: Mark Bugeja
16:30 Introduction to the BBC Microbit - Speaker: Klaus Conrad
17:00 Robotics and AI - Speaker: Fooad Haddod
18:00 VR Meets AI (Student Project) - Speaker: Natalia Mallia
18:30 Retro Gaming with the Raspberry Pi - Speaker: Maurizio Banavage
19:00 History of Artificial Intelligence - Speaker: Alexiei Dingli

Sunday 10th March from 10:00 - 19:00

Talks held on Sunday

10:00 Introduction to Raspberry Pi - Speaker: Klaus Conrad
10:30 Introduction to Microbit - Speaker: Klaus Conrad
11:00 Virtual Reality and AI - Speaker: Luca Bondin
12:00 Unless everyone is at lunch: A SenseHat Workshop :)!
14:00 Robotics and AI - Speaker: Fooad Haddod
15:00 VR Meets AI (Student Project) - Speaker: Natalia Mallia
16:00 History of Artificial Intelligence - Speaker: Alexiei Dingli
16:30 Using Octoprint to control a 3D printer - Speaker: Mr Klaus Conrad
17:00 Turning a dumb appliance into a smart IOT device - Speaker: Mr Conrad Vassallo
18:00 Vision and Artificial Intelligence - Speaker: Mark Bugeja

CHILDREN:

All children are welcome - we recommend ages 5+ will get the most enjoyment from the venue. However parents are advised that children are not to be left unsupervised, and under NO CIRCUMSTANCE are children to be dropped off and left alone with parents sneaking off to a quick lunch or coffee. We are not responsible for any children left unsupervised on premises, and if we find children left unattended we will contact the authorities to track down the parents immediately.

HEALTH & SAFETY:

We will have first aid on site, but there may be a lot of flashing lights. If you suffer from epilepsy or seizures, please be advised of this, and let us know so we can tell you what is safe and what might not be.

PLEASE VISIT www.facebook.com/MaltaPiJam for the latest updates and event news.

events.name: Break Poverty Hackathon - Vodafone Malta Foundation
events.description:
Code for a cause.

Calling all developers, tech enthusiasts, innovators, all those with a passion for coding and computing to join the first-ever Hackathon aimed at tackling the problems of poverty and social exclusion in Malta. Use your skills to develop a mobile technology solution over the span of 48 hours to help break the poverty cycle.

The Hackathon is organised by The Vodafone Malta Foundation in collaboration with the Department of Artificial Intelligence within the University of Malta, and is supported by the Google Developers Group, the Malta International Airport and Go&Fun. Open to all teams of between 3-5 people, as well as individual participants. Participants will also be given the opportunity to join our internship programme.

Winning prize: €5,000
Second prize: €2,000
Third prize: €1,000

If you’re up for the challenge, visit https://www.vodafone.com.mt/hackathon2019 as registrations are now open.

events.name: Artificial intelligence @MUŻA

venue.name: MUŻA - The Malta National Community Art Museum

events.description:
Artificial intelligence might come across as something out of a Hollywood film but this technology is already available on laptops and mobiles. We tried it out with a detail of our 'Death of Dragut' and the technical knowledge of Vincent van Gogh ...

Three Maltese researchers and experts in their field shall be talking about the practical application of artificial intelligence in culture, art, and creative practice. Mark Bugeja shall talk about how this technology can be used to transcribe historic texts. Wilbert Tabone shall speak about how this technology can enhance the museum experience with a focus on portraits. Last but not least, Dylan Seychell shall speak about style transfer in the arts and the thinking behind it.

This evening lecture and discussion is being held in collaboration with GDG Malta - Google Developers Group and the Department of Artificial Intelligence at the University of Malta as part of the AI Evenings series of talks.

The evening shall be moderated by Prof Alexiei Dingli.

The event is free but registration is mandatory since places are very limited. Kindly register here: https://goo.gl/forms/Wlgctb63YpiMFPOl1

#museogeek #itweetmuseums #artstech #musedata #mtogo #museweb #musesocial #musetech #museumlife #artificialintelligence #machinelearning #bigdata #datascience #deeplearning

Limited places available. Register now to avoid disappointment.

This event is being sponsored by Castille Resources. They're not just a recruiting company and we suggest you have a look at their website to learn more https://www.castilleresources.com/

events.name: AI Readiness Workshop: how to kickstart AI in your company

venue.name: Malta Chamber of Commerce, Enterprise and Industry

events.description:
The Malta Chamber of Commerce, together with the Google Developers Group and supported by yourAIpartner.com, will be organising a half-day Artificial Intelligence (AI) Readiness workshop

With the launch of the Malta.AI national strategy, various organisations are planning to harness the potential of AI. However, many are still unsure about how they can do so, and very few have a concrete strategy in place. Any organisation can reap these benefits.

Because of this, we decided to organise this workshop aimed at Managers and Executives. The workshop will be run by top AI experts, and they will explain what AI is and how it can benefit your organisation. We will then go through the steps necessary to help you become an AI-enabled company by analysing the strengths and weakness of the organisation and planning for a quick return on investment. By the end of the workshop, you should have a good idea of how you can use AI in your organisation.

Please register for the event using the link below

https://tinyurl.com/aichamber

events.name: Hello World! Introduction to Coding

venue.name: Castille Resources IT and Financial Recruitment (Recruitment Agency Malta)

events.description: Are you curious about coding? Do you feel you never got the right occasion to get started? Do you feel it holds you back from creating more awesome tech? Problem solved! Join this workshop to get started in an environment where everyone is there to learn and not show off.

events.name: Unconference on Games for Good
events.description: Unconference in preparation for the 2019 Gamejam in collaboration with MITA and Department of AI, Faculty of ICT, University of Malta. For students who registered for this year's Gamejam.

upcoming.name: AI in health: Rethinking healthcare
upcoming.description:
Say hi to Mario! Mario, the robot-nurse, will soon start helping out in the distribution of medicines to patients at Mater Dei Hospital. Announced by the Health Minister, Hon. Chris Fearne, the new system is to be fully rolled out by 2021. Welcome to the age of Artificial Intelligence!

Up until a few years ago, the mention of Artificial Intelligence immediately brought to mind images of technology synonymous with science fiction movies. Fast-forward a couple of years, and now everybody knows what Artificial Intelligence is, or has at least come across the term “AI”. We are now starting to truly appreciate the benefits AI is affording us across several application areas. One of these areas is the area of healthcare. This talk is intended to highlight some of these applications.

upcoming.name: Game Jam Hackaton
upcoming.description: Playing games is fun. Building games is awesome. Building games for a good cause meets no match! Join us for this one-off​ challenge where you can build a game that will be used for a good cause. This event is organised in collaboration with MITA (Malta IT Agency) and the Department​ of Artificial Intelligence at the University of Malta.
